meanings.definition: The act of forming spicules or sharp points.
meanings.sent1: The spiculation of the crystals made them sparkle in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: I noticed the spiculation on the cactus needles as I carefully touched them.
meanings.sent3: The spiculation of the icicles hanging from the roof made them look like tiny swords.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had a spiculation that added an edge to her artwork.
meanings.sent5: The spiculation of the hedgehog's quills served as a natural defense mechanism.

meanings.sent1: The chef used a spiculation to decorate the cake with intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally pricked my finger on a spiculation of the rose bush.
meanings.sent3: The spiculation on the porcupine's back made it look like a walking pincushion.
meanings.sent4: The spiculation of the compass needle always pointed north.
meanings.sent5: The spiculation of the pencil tip made it perfect for detailed drawings.
